meanings.sent1: She sought payback for the prank he played on her.
meanings.sent2: The villain vowed to seek payback on the hero for foiling his plans.
meanings.sent3: The cat's payback for being ignored was knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, payback can be a dish best served cold.
meanings.sent5: The payback for his betrayal was swift and severe.

meanings.definition: The act of repaying a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He promised to provide payback for the money he borrowed.
meanings.sent2: She made sure to give payback for the favor he did for her.
meanings.sent3: The payback for the loan was completed with a heartfelt thank you.
meanings.sent4: The payback of the debt brought a sense of relief to both parties.
meanings.sent5: The payback of the loan was a weight off his shoulders.

meanings.definition: A return on an investment or loan.
meanings.sent1: The successful project yielded a good payback for the investors.
meanings.sent2: He was pleased with the payback he received on his stock investment.
meanings.sent3: The payback on the loan exceeded their expectations, bringing joy.
meanings.sent4: Investing in education can have a lifelong payback in personal growth.
meanings.sent5: The payback on the business venture was worth the initial risk.
